level.heading: Conversion to foreign insurer.
level.text: Any domestic insurer may, upon the approval of the Commissioner, transfer its domicile to any state in which it is admitted to transact the business of insurance, and upon such a transfer shall cease to be a domestic insurer and shall be admitted to the District, if qualified, as a foreign insurer. The Commissioner shall approve any proposed transfer unless he or she determines such a transfer is not in the best interest of the policyholders of the District.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 15-354 deleted "of Insurance and Securities" following "approval of the Commissioner".
